channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: 2 large sofas dumped on pavement, 9th November
item.description:
2 large sofas dumped on pavement outside 4-5 Copley Close. Dumped overnight 8-9 November.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Chalmers Walk, Camberwell, London

item.title: To much foiliage, leaves etc. starting to build up on the pavement. It may cause an accident., 9th November
item.description:
To much foiliage, leaves etc. starting to build up on the pavement. It may cause an accident. Please can you send someone over to clean it up? It has been like this for nearly 2 - 3 weeks now. Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Anerley Park, Crystal Palace, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road very dark and it’s dark early now and it’s not light in the morning either., 9th November
item.description:
This has been like this for months! Neighbours have already reported this issue.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 67, Greenwich South Street, London

item.title: Metal fence about to collapse, 9th November
item.description:
The metal fencing around Bedonwell Road open space is very shaky. It’s going to collapse if someone leans on it. And it’s rusty and sharp. The whole fence is very dangerous as it’s so precarious. I can wobble it back and forth.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bedonwell Road, West Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Subsidence, 9th November

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Woodcroft, Palmers Green, London

item.title: To the right of the driveway of the Harben Road Estate, 9th November
item.description:
The road has raised and the tarmac surface has cracked. It has caused a trip hazard. I am disabled and caught my foot on it and tripped over. Resulting in spending a day in A&E University College Hospital, undertaking a number of tests and being x-rayed to ensure there was no broken bones. 3 X Photos have been attached for reference.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Harben Road, South Hampstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Noisy barking dogs constantly left in garden, 9th November
item.description:
The house on the corner of Gerda Road/Southwood Road has dogs that are an ongoing public nuisance, and have been for well over a year. They constantly bark in the garden late into the evening, and this repeatedly wakes ups my young children.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 37, Southwood Road, New Eltham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned car?, 9th November
item.description:
Car been parked outside 69 Swingate lane for a long while. It’s under a cover so registration, model, colour and condition not visible. No idea of owner. No idea if vehicle road legal
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Swingate Lane, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet
